availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John T. Bolinger (Graves County, KY, merchant)

body.p: Mayfield, Graves County, Kentucky, merchant. Virginia native. Married to Martha E. Halliburton on May 3, 1858. Father of Effie Bolinger, Lena S. Bolinger, Johnnie Bolinger, Walter Bolinger, Daisy Bolinger, and Roy N. Bolinger. Charged with working with General Eleazer A. Paine to extort citizens in and around Paducah, Kentucky in July and August 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 337.
Find A Grave, "J T Bolinger (1825-1895)," Memorial #145408255, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145408255# (accessed June 6, 2018).
“Investigation of General Paine’s Administration at Paducah,” Louisville Weekly Journal, 4 October 1864.
